No crack is currently available for this new game. HeroMaster was the releaser, but it is a clone. I rather doubt HeroMaster has the source code to the game, and has probably not installed it to check for the protection method.

The easiest method to learn is to install it yourself and see if SecuROM loads when the game does, if not, check off SecuROM and check for the rest of the many protections available.

It is likely just a file it will try to install when the game is installed, like most protection methods. Check the redist directories on the image and see what is there.

That may not answer your question, but 9 out of 10 times it will tell you what to narrow your search to.

As for myself, I actually hate comic books and games based upon them. But I hope everyone enjoys this. Remember to support the makers if the game is enjoyable.

@Timbo6669

The Amazing Spiderman PC Requirements

First of all meet your system specifications to game’s requirements.

PC Requirements:

    OS: Windows XP (SP3)/Vista (SP2)/Windows 7
    Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.6 GHz or AMD Equivalent
    Memory: 3 GB system RAM
    Hard Disk Space: 8.1 GB Free Space
    Video Card: GeForce 8800 GT series with 512 MB RAM or ATI Radeon HD 3850 with 512 MB RAM
    DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c or DirectX 10
    Sound: DirectX compatible Sound card

Plus,

Possible Solution 1: Run the game as ‘Run as Administrator’ by right clicking. If you are using Steam then navigate to:

    32bit – C:Program FilesSteamsteamappscommonSniper Elite V2.exe
    64bit – C:Program Files (x86)SteamsteamappscommonSniper Elite V2.exe
    Right click on game.exe and select “Run as Administrator”.

Possible Solution 2: Run the game in compatibility with Windows XP SP3.

Possible Solution 3: If game doesn’t launch, make sure you’re connected to the internet and try restarting Steam/your computer.

Possible Solution 4: Also, you can try to lower the game’s settings by disabling VSync and multi-sampling and turning down environment detail levels.

Possible Solution 5: Try to Update Your Graphics Cards and Motherboard Drivers and you can download them from Here.

Possible Solution 6: Try different resolution options on your PC.

Possible Solution 7: For NVidia users, go into NVidia control panel and add your game.exe and make it "use NVidia GPU" to resolve this issue. And also try this, go to NVidia control panel and check if game.exe has to instances. If there are two instances, set both to use your specific GPU instead of automatic.

Possible Solution 1: Run the game as ‘Run as Administrator’ by right clicking. If you are using Steam then navigate to:

    32bit – C:Program FilesSteamsteamappscommonSniper Elite V2.exe
    64bit – C:Program Files (x86)SteamsteamappscommonSniper Elite V2.exe
    Right click on game.exe and select “Run as Administrator”.

Possible Solution 2: Run the game in compatibility with Windows XP SP3.

Possible Solution 3: If game doesn’t launch, make sure you’re connected to the internet and try restarting Steam/your computer.

Possible Solution 4: Also, you can try to lower the game’s settings by disabling VSync and multi-sampling and turning down environment detail levels.

Possible Solution 5: Try to Update Your Graphics Cards and Motherboard Drivers and you can download them from Here.

Possible Solution 6: Try different resolution options on your PC.

Possible Solution 7: For NVidia users, go into NVidia control panel and add your game.exe and make it "use NVidia GPU" to resolve this issue. And also try this, go to NVidia control panel and check if game.exe has to instances. If there are two instances, set both to use your specific GPU instead of automatic.
